00046 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;
00047 
00048 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({          \
00049     (l) = ull & 0xffffffff;                     \
00050     (h) = ull >> 32;                            \
00051 })
00052 
00053 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({             \
00054     unsigned long long ull;                     \
00055     asm ( "": "=A"(ull) : "d"(h), "a"(l));      \
00056     ull;                                        \
00057 })
00058 
00059 /* Fast longs multiplication. */
00060 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00061 rthal_ullmul(unsigned long m1, unsigned long m2) {
00062     /* Gcc (at least for versions 2.95 and higher) optimises correctly here. */
00063     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00064 }
00065 
00066 /* const helper for rthal_uldivrem, so that the compiler will eliminate
00067    multiple calls with same arguments, at no additionnal cost. */
00068 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00069 __rthal_uldivrem(const unsigned long long ull, const unsigned long d) {
00070 
00071     unsigned long long ret;
00072     __asm__ ("divl %1" : "=A,A"(ret) : "r,?m"(d), "A,A"(ull));
00073     /* Exception if quotient does not fit on unsigned long. */
00074     return ret;
00075 }
00076 
00077 static inline __attribute_const__ int rthal_imuldiv (const int i,
00078                                                      const int mult,
00079                                                      const int div) {
00080 
00081     /* Returns (unsigned)i =
00082                (unsigned long long)i*(unsigned)(mult)/(unsigned)div. */
00083     const unsigned long ui = (const unsigned long) i;
00084     const unsigned long um = (const unsigned long) mult;
00085     return __rthal_uldivrem((const unsigned long long) ui * um, div);
00086 }
00087 
00088 /* Fast long long division: when the quotient and remainder fit on 32 bits.
00089    Recent compilers remove redundant calls to this function. */
00090 static inline unsigned long rthal_uldivrem(unsigned long long ull,
00091                                            const unsigned long d,
00092                                            unsigned long *const rp) {
00093 
00094     unsigned long q, r;
00095     ull = __rthal_uldivrem(ull, d);
00096     __asm__ ( "": "=d"(r), "=a"(q) : "A"(ull));
00097     if(rp)
00098         *rp = r;
00099     return q;
00100 }
00101 
00102 
00103 /* Division of an unsigned 96 bits ((h << 32) + l) by an unsigned 32 bits.
00104    Common building block for ulldiv and llimd. */
00105 static inline unsigned long long __rthal_div96by32 (const unsigned long long h,
00106                                                     const unsigned long l,
00107                                                     const unsigned long d,
00108                                                     unsigned long *const rp) {
00109 
00110     u_long rh;
00111     const u_long qh = rthal_uldivrem(h, d, &rh);
00112     const unsigned long long t = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, l);
00113     const u_long ql = rthal_uldivrem(t, d, rp);
00114 
00115     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00116 }
00117 
00118 
00119 /* Slow long long division. Uses rthal_uldivrem, hence has the same property:
00120    the compiler removes redundant calls. */
00121 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (const unsigned long long ull,
00122                                                const unsigned long d,
00123                                                unsigned long *const rp) {
00124 
00125     unsigned long h, l;
00126     __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l);
00127     return __rthal_div96by32(h, l, d, rp);
00128 }
00129 
00130 /* Replaced the helper with rthal_ulldiv. */
00131 #define rthal_u64div32c rthal_ulldiv
00132 
00133 static inline __attribute_const__
00134 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00135                                    const unsigned long m,
00136                                    const unsigned long d) {
00137 
00138     unsigned long long th, tl;
00139     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll;
00140 
00141     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00142     tl = (unsigned long long) opl * m;
00143     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00144     th = (unsigned long long) oph * m;
00145     /* op * m == ((th + tlh) << 32) + tll */
00146 
00147     __asm__ (  "addl %1, %%eax\n\t"
00148                "adcl $0, %%edx"
00149                : "=A,A"(th)
00150                : "r,?m"(tlh), "A,A"(th) );
00151     /* op * m == (th << 32) + tll */
00152 
00153     return __rthal_div96by32(th, tll, d, NULL);
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline __attribute_const__ long long rthal_llimd (const long long op,
00157                                                          const unsigned long m,
00158                                                          const unsigned long d) {
00159 
00160     if(op < 0LL)
00161         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00162     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00163 }
00164 
00165 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00166     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00167     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00168             : "=r,r" (word)
00169             : "r,?m"  (word));
00170     return word;
00171 }

00230 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00231 #define rthal_local_irq_save(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00232 #define rthal_local_irq_restore(x)      adeos_restore_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain,(x))

00251 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00252 
00253     rthal_cli();
00254     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00255 }
00256 
00257 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00258 
00259     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00260     rthal_sti();
00261 }

00263 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00264 
00265     unsigned long flags;
00266     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00267     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00268     return flags;
00269 }

00271 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00272                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00273     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00274     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);
00275 }

00277 #if !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00278 
00279 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00280    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00281    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00282    instead. */
00283 
00284 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00285     return ((struct thread_info *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL)))->task;
00286 }
00287 
00288 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00289 
00290 {
00291     int *esp;
00292 
00293     __asm__ ("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r,?m" (esp));
00294 
00295     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00296         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00297 
00298     return get_current();
00299 }
00300 
00301 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00302 
00303 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00304     return current;
00305 }
00306 
00307 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid) {
00308     return current;
00309 }
00310 
00311 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00313 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00314 
00315     if (delay) {
00316         unsigned long flags;
00317         rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00318 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00319         apic_read(APIC_LVTT);
00320         apic_write_around(APIC_LVTT,RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_VECTOR);
00321         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00322         apic_write_around(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00323 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00324         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00325         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00326 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00327         rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00328     }
00329 }
